page.title: 02Bryanston Buildings
page.content: The main building was the country residence of Lord Portman,built in the 1890's. The architect was Norman Shaw; he based his design on Menars,a Loire chateau.The original house remains as it was, despite a major change of use. Around it have been added labs, the Coade Hall,the Greek theatre,the Music school,a classroom block & residential buildings. The stables were converted first to science labs, next housing for boys,then separate boys' & girls' houses and finally a girls' house.The main house,first designed for 2, now sleeps over 300 boys,feeds 600 or more & accommodates all the administration & much of the classwork of the school. The main building is adaptable but structural change is difficult:4 weeks were needed recently to make a new doorway because of the thickness of the internal walls.
